column4: Help - I have a palm pilot that's being detected by the device manager but not by any of the palm pilot apps (Gnome-pilot, jpilot, kpilot). What do I do?
problem with my Palm - anyone willing to help ???????????????????????'
it _is_ detected by the hardware manager, but not by any of the pilot programs.
I can't figure out, from this, what /dev/ it's on...
are you following any sort of guide or how to?
I wouldn't know where to find one...
I can give you the info from the device manager...
(not all of it, obviously... just tell me what you need.)
there should be some doco for how to use gnome-ilot etc
I've been following the instructions, but they don't speak of anything similar... the help file is also fairly useless...
Tungsten E - seen as Tungsten T by the Device Manager
it is a usb interface. What's dmesg?
run 'dmesg' on a terminal and it gives you kernel messages
may I msg you a section of the results?
